info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 8:23AM EST until December 27 at 6:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Most of Transylvania County in western North Carolina. * WHEN...Until noon EST. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 815 AM EST, With widespread rain continuing to fall across the region, many streams, creeks and rivers continued to rise with storm total rainfall nearing 4 inches in spots. Remain wary of rising water levels and developing flooding throughout the Upper French Broad basin. This includes, but is not limited to the Little River and Davidson River. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Gorges State Park, Lake Toxaway, Dupont State Forest, Connestee, Balsam Grove, Cedar Mountain and Penrose. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
